data.title: University of the East: admission, contact number, courses, fees
data.meta_description: The UNIVERSITY OF THE EAST is among the renowned higher education learning institutions in the Philippines. It is therefore wise for parents to enroll their children in this center.
data.text:
Going to college is not all about getting a prestigious degree. Getting a university education will give you a competitive edge in the job market. Choosing the right learning centre will ensure that you develop as a person and get the career opportunity that you always desired. One of the best learning centres you can enrol in is the University of the East that is located in Manila.

University of the East Manila is known to offer quality education to its students. The graduates are well prepared for life and different work opportunities.

University of the East Caloocan

UE Caloocan started in two rented rooms on Dasmarinas, Street, Manila. The facility began with 110 students enrolling in Certified Public Accounting review, in 1946. The higher learning institute was started by a group of business educators who wanted to help the country.

However, the facility was sold in 1990 by a business tycoon known as Lucio Tan. The school was at one time labeled as the largest institution in Asia. The higher learning center got this title, and the registration of the students reached 65,000. UE Manila is known has also been granted the Autonomous Status by the Commission on Higher Education (CHED). It is one of the 68 private higher learning education regulating bodies to get the CHED recognition.

Admission

Before enrolling, it is paramount for you to go to the website of the institution to learn when the next semester will start. The University of the East admission periods have deadlines. It is essential to make sure that the admission is done on time.

Pre-admission requirements include:

Accomplished application form

Two copies of applicants 2x2 photo

School ID

New admission requirements are:

Report cards Form 138

Certificate of Good Moral Character

Copy of NSO birth certificate

UE-CET results

Other additional requirements include:

For the salutatorian and valedictorian, present a certificate by High School principal. The document should be inclusive of the number of graduates and the award received.

For the resident international student, present the Alien Certificate of registration (ACR). The Bureau of Immigration should issue this document.

For the students who work full time, they should have a certificate of employment.

For those applying for the College of Fine Arts, they need to pass the UE talent test that will be administered for the College.

READ ALSO: International school Manila 2020: a comprehensive list

Contact Information

For you to reach the education center, use the contact information below:

University of the East contact number: (+632) 735 5471 loc. 398 or 399/ (+632) 735 8577

University of the East Address: 2219 Claro M. Recto Avenue, Sampaloc, Manila

Website: ue.edu.ph

Email: admission@ue.edu.ph

Courses

The University of the East courses include 13 college program, 16 master programs, and 4 doctorate programs.

The courses offered by the facility are found on the website of the facility. Before applying for the college, you will need to meet with the minimum pass mark.

Tuition fee

Below are some critical things to note regarding the University of the East tuition fee:

The UE school fee tuition is inclusive of miscellaneous fees.

Units offered range from 20-23 units.

The down payment is 10,500 pesos; the balance should be paid in 4 equal months.

5% discount payment for school fees when one is enrolling

Online application

The University of the East online application offers online application for both new applications and those returning for further studies. The online application provides steps on how the application can be made.

The application can be obtained when one visits the official website of UE. The University of the East portal offers login information to the students who have been registered. It is paramount to find out if there is any university of the east uniform needed.

READ ALSO: University of Baguio student portal, courses, fees, address

Entrance examination

There are some courses like a degree in law which require one to sit University of the East entrance exam.

Scholarships

The University of the East scholarship are either full or partial.

A full scholarship offers:

Full tuition fee payment

Full Miscellaneous fees

Monthly stipend

Book allowance

Transport allowance

Partial scholarships offer:

Half the tuition fee

Half the miscellaneous fees

Monthly stipends

Book allowance

Transport allowance

READ ALSO: Dominique Cojuangco graduates with flying colors; Gretchen Barretto reacts

Senior high school

The University of the east senior high school and Elementary departments are open for the applicants from Kinder to Grade 12. The requirement depends on the classification of the students.

Careers

Information about the University of the East careers is available on their official website. Applications are send to the department of human resource.

Alumni

Here is a list University of the East notable alumni:

Noli de Castro

Christopher de Leon

Virgilio S. Almario

Peter Musngi

Andrew Tan

Robert Jaworski

University of the East is without a doubt, one of the top learning centers in the Philippines. Any parent looking for an institution of higher learning should consider this school owed to the many years of success in offering quality education to learners.

Source: KAMI.com.gh
